#summary keyla - a keyboard layout switcher

keyla is a program that enables you to set keyboard shortcuts for switching keyboard layout. You may wish to have a look at  [http://code.google.com/p/keyla/wiki/en_Screenshots brief description and screenshots]. There is also
[http://code.google.com/p/keyla/wiki/en_Alternatives a list of software that can be used instead of keyla].

==== Supported Operating Systems ====

keyla runs on Windows, starting with Windows. Earlier version of Windows have not been tested yet.

==== Localization ====

The program interface and installer are available in English and Russian. If you would like to help, please look at [http://code.google.com/p/keyla/wiki/en_TranslatingTheProgram interface localization guide] and [http://code.google.com/p/keyla/wiki/en_TranslatingInstaller installer localization guide].

==== Features ====

  * indication of the current layout in the system tray
  * a shortcut to change layouts cyclically
  * shortcuts to switch to a particular layout^1^
  * can provide single layout for all applications (i.e., global layout)
  * can prohibit swithing layouts from without^2^

^1^ These shortcuts may be useful for those who use more than two keyboard layouts.

^2^ I.e., keyla allows you to prevent switching layouts using the system shortcut or the Language bar.

The program currently contains icons for Russian and English layouts only. To learn how to add a missing icon please see the [http://code.google.com/p/keyla/wiki/en_AddingLayoutIcons adding layout icons how-to].

[http://code.google.com/p/keyla/wiki/en_ChangeLog Change log]
